column4: I need a terminal command to change the dns adresses. I could not find it anywhere. Where does network manager of gnome 3 saves the configuration files? or someone can suggest me something?
edit /etc/resolv.conf
You must have a dhcp server that is giving you another nameserver address ???
no. dhsp does not give me anything. there is a default dns ofcourse but dhsp can not force me to use i gess.. right?
also i can change the dns from gui(even witut been root)
What I'm saying is that there must be a dhcp server on your network that is giving out another nameserver IP.
ok. i don't know what are you talking about exactly. so can you tell me what should i try ?
What I'm trying to say is that you may have more than one dhcp server running on your network.  Find the one that is giving out bogus info and turn it off.
no. i don't use wireles. i just connect with cable. SO i have just one dhsp server. the main problem is network manager saves the configuration files somewhere which i can not find.
There is only one place for nameserver addresses, /etc/resolv.conf
You should start over and tell us the exact issue you are having?
You have a router.  Right?

İ lock this file as root (after i cahnge it with mayn dns servers), network manager could not write on it. it does not give me an error or something. but i look guı of network manager. isee that it use my old dns adresses. also i check it if it is true. how thats possible?
Do you not have any other computers on your newtork?  Just the one you are on?
yes i have a laptop with wireles... the same think is going on it.
Is the nameserver IP address in /etc/resolv.conf changing?
if i change from GUI 8.8.8.8 the network manager writes on configuration file 8.8.8.8. but if i change it from file, nwetwork manager does not listening me. it just use what writes on it's gui.
I have no idea what you just said.  Can you re-phrase it?
ifconfig > ip-config ; route -n >> ip-config ; cat /etc/resolv.conf >> ip-config ; pastebinit ip-config   #Send resulting URL
If your router is giving out a nameserver IP that you don't want to use, change it.
See my pm
